an7.83:1.1: Then Venerable Upāli went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an7.83:2.1: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
an7.83:2.3: certain things don’t lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
an7.83:2.4: You should definitely bear in mind that such things are
an7.83:2.5: not the teaching, not the training, and not the Teacher’s instructions.
an7.83:2.7: certain things do lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
